Name: Springtime for Hitler
Description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east....

But, why, exactly did France fall? Against the Odds' 2015 annual features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question. They’ve each settled on a single overriding theme to focus on.

Springtime for Hitler explores the angle that the Germans at this time were quite simply indeed "supermen" at the top of their game. Possessing the best tactical air force, the best plans and doctrine, and well motivated by National-Socialist ideology, they were unstoppable. Or were they?
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Seeds of Disaster
Description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east.

But why, exactly, did France fall? Against the Odds 2017 Annual  features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question.

The Seeds of Disaster is a game about how events of the 1930s affected World War II, most especially the German invasion 
of the West in 1940. This game connects a war campaign with  the military preparations, intelligence developments, and  diplomacy that preceded it. It is an attempt to represent a  piece of history as interconnected with other historical developments. This is a two-player game in which one player takes the Germans and the other the Western Allies, including 
France, Great Britain, Belgium, and Holland. Victory is determined by control of Mobilization Center and Objective Areas at the end of the last turn of play.

In broad outline, what you see here is a game that is multi-dimensional and coupled. The initial phase of play creates a game history of the 1930s to generate the concrete situation for the German invasion of the West in 1940. By intertwining fresh dimensions of Intelligence and Command, the game creates new ways in which the 1940 situation can be distinctive from 
one play of the game to the next. The invasion campaign is the culmination of the game. With this partially scripted history, 
how does the war progress? The geography will be the same, the deployment of the forces may be similar, but the details of 
the forces and their Intelligence and Command postures can be very different.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Betrayal!
Description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east.

But why, exactly, did France fall? Against the Odds 2017 Annual  features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question.

'Betrayal!' is a strategic level game of the German invasion of France, Belgium, and the Netherlands in May 1940. After 
finishing campaigns in Poland, Denmark, and Norway, Hitler turned to France. The goal was to knock France down and 
then prepare for the subjugation of Britain and the invasion of the Soviet Union.

Pre-war planning, coupled with valuable experience gained in Poland, would lead the Wehrmacht to excel in lightning 
warfare never before seen on such a massive scale. While the French had re-visited World War One with a static Maginot 
Line defending their border, the Germans went beyond this and brought in blitzkrieg. There were a few bumps along the 
way. The smaller British army and those from tiny Belgium and Netherlands tried to help France.

The game has two Allied players, one French and one British. They will alternate, depending on initiative, in handling 
the automata German side. Internal differences between the allies can arise according to their separate and unique victory conditions.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Data Leak
Description:
Data Leak is a game of making words and breaking passwords. Acting as a skilled computer hacker, you will attempt to break your opponents’ passwords before they can break yours, knowing that these passwords must be formed from a pool of only 45 letters. 
Unfortunately, data leaks happen every turn and you’ll have to be canny about which letters of your password you reveal to your opponents. 
By browsing the darknet and using threats such as viruses, worms and trojan horses, more letters will be revealed until you eventually break your opponents’ passwords. 
The last player with an unguessed password will win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Desde el Banco: Fútbol de Tablero
Description:
Desde el Banco ("From the Bench"), Tabletop Soccer, is a sports strategy game for two players, where each one is the Coach of a fantasy soccer team. Select the team, build your squad, raise your formation and take them to the field.

A board game that undoubtedly awakens the passions and mischief of soccer, accompanied by the chance of the dice. The components are soccer player and team cards, big-headed soccer player miniatures, ball miniature, interlocking colored rings to identify the teams, energy tokens, dice and a flexible fabric printed board, all in a very colorful and eye-catching box.

During the match, the Coach must put together their best strategy, use the special skills of the players, and the special abilities of the team players to score the goal.

Each Coach take the victory by scoring the most goals.

Name: Relick TCG: Character Deck Yuno
Description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

Yuno's deck is based on re-rolling the dice to have a second chance

Name: Relick TCG: Character Deck Osamu
Description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

Osamu's deck is based on looking for the cards that you need the most from your deck and bringing them to your hand

Name: Relick TCG: Character Deck WD
Description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

WD's deck is all about discarding cards from your hand for crazy fun effects

Name: Relick TCG: Theme Deck Hiperman
Description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

The hyperman deck is based on charging your lazer cannon every turn to obtain a very powerful attack.

Name: Kaput
Description: It's the end of the world, as an asteroid is barreling toward Earth, with the very real possibility of making the planet go Kaput. Lucky for you, you're a wealthy elite with your own underground bunker within which to ride out the apocalypse. However, what you never counted on were all the "normies," showing up, at the last moment, wanting you to save them. You can't take them all in, and if your fellow elites form alliances with the best prospects, you won't retain power inside the bunker for long. So, choose wisely, my friend.

Name: OOMANS: The card game
Description:
Welcome to the world of Oomonia, where Oomans live a peaceful and simple life. That was until Omenns arrived! Omenns are chaotic shape shifting creatures that can look like any Ooman so that they can blend in and wreak havoc. Thankfully Shibby, an Ooman's best friend and his fellow Oomans are here to stop this once and for all by capturing Omenns using specially designed gadgets!

In this 2-5 player game, players will help Shibby capture these Omenns by matching capture gadgets of the same name. Use breakout cards to breakout Omenns from other players to have a chance to capture them yourself. Players will use the cards along with special action cards to boost their turn. Once the deck runs out of cards, the player with the most Omenns wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: La Cité des ombres
Description:
The City of Shadows board game is a co-creation of the Les Baroudeurs brand and Agent Paper.

Discover a strategic board game full of twists and turns playable in 2 teams of 2, 4, or 6 players. Your goal is simple: take control of Rennes (the city, not those of Santa Claus).

For this, several means are available to you:
- Capture all the properties of the game board
- Kill all the characters of the opposing team
- Arrest the entire opposing clan by the police
- Discreetly poison the drinks of opposing players (this victory mode can only work once against the same players)

Explore the city of Rennes and its iconic late 18th-century locations while using strategy, cunning, and composure to win the game.


Le jeu de plateau Cité des Ombres est une co-création de la marque Les Baroudeurs et d’Agent Paper.
Découvrez un jeu de plateau stratégique plein de rebondissements jouable en 2 équipes de 2, 4, ou 6 joueurs. Votre but est simple : prenez le contrôle de Rennes (la ville, pas ceux du Père Noël). Pour cela, plusieurs moyens sont mis à votre disposition :
– Capturez toutes les propriétés du plateau de jeu
– Tuez tous les personnages de l’équipe adverse
– Faites arrêtez par la police tout le clan adverse
– Empoisonnez discrètement les boissons des joueurs adverses (ce mode de victoire ne peut fonctionner qu’une fois contre les mêmes joueurs)Explorez la ville de Rennes et ses lieux emblématiques de la fin du XVIIIe siècle tout en faisant preuve de stratégie, de ruse et de sang froid afin de gagner la partie.

Name: The Gates of Medina (fan expansion for Medina)
Description:
Unofficial variant, tested and approved by the author

The gates allow you to leave the city. 
Each side of the city must have an opening which is indicated either by the free space separating the walls originating from either corner tower, or by a gate placed by a player which indicates the limit for placing walls.
During their turn, a player can choose to place a gate as one of their actions, respecting the following conditions:

     The gate must be placed adjacent to a wall; it cannot be placed directly adjacent to a tower.
     The gate must either be placed next to an empty space on the board, or next to one occupied by a merchant.
     Only one gate can be placed on each side of the city.


Consequences of placing a gate

     The gate stops the construction of the wall against which it is placed, so the wall originating from the same corner tower can’t be extended beyond the gate.
     The wall coming from the opposite corner tower on the same side of the city can continue to be lengthened until it eventually reaches the gate.
     A building or a stable can’t be built against a gate. However, a merchant can be placed next to a gate.


Complete rules in english and french are in the links

Name: ThreeTale: Moonglow
Description:
ThreeÐ¢ale - Moonglow is an expansion for ThreeTale.

New heroes : Wheat Bread, Krali Marko and the Blind Girl are on their way to the Last Blacksmith or the Darkness at the End of the tunnel

Name: Karak: Sidhar, Kirima, Elspeth
Description: Three new heroes who venture into the depths of Karak, seeking gold and to destroy the infamous dragon. The small expansion consists of three boards for the alchemist Doctor Sidhar, the warrior princess Elspeth and the beast hunter Kirima. Three card board standees, plastic stands and an international instructions are inculded as well.

Name: Golden Top Game
Description:
The game combines questions with bets. On a circuit, the players move their game pieces by rolling the dice. Bets can be placed on the dice roll of a fellow player or on the correct answer to a question card. A fast rounding of the playing field brings additional money. The player who has collected the most money after an agreed time wins.

—user summary

Name: Sunbed Rush
Description:
Sunbed Rush is a strategic card game.

While reserving sunbeds in real life is not very kind to your fellow guests at a resort, it is absolutely mandatory in Sunbed Rush! Place your towels to reserve your sunbed. Secure your sunbed with an object to make it look like you really are in the neighborhood. Or place a guest on your sunbed; a guest who will help you with his or her quirks. Make sure to secure the best and the most sunbeds to earn points and win the game!

The game is played in 8 rounds. Each round players receive 1 new card from the draw pile after which they all choose 2 cards to play in that game round.
A player can select 2 cards in any combination of:
- towel cards (to reserve a spot at any pool)
- object cards (towels with an object on it cannot be removed)
- guest cards (placed on your towel to help you)
- activity cards (to clear the entire pool of the guests indicated on the activity card)

After 8 rounds, players no longer have cards in their hands and the game ends.

The player with the most points wins, points are counted at the end of the game where you earn points for:
1. Having the most towels at a pool: Each pool card indicates the number of points players can earn for having the most towels at that pool
2. Empty/unoccupied towel: each unoccupied towel (a towel without a guest or object) earns 1 additional point

—description from the publisher

Name: Klattschen: White Edition
Description: The official Expansion includes 60 new Cards with 45 new orders.

Name: Don't Get Got!:  Working From Home Edition
Description:
Work can be tough — even when you’re sitting on the sofa. Luckily, we’ve got just the thing to help brighten up your virtual office. A mini game designed to be played with your workmates, while you work from home.
You and your co-workers each start with six secret missions. The first player to complete three of their missions, wins.
Every single one of these missions involves tricking another player, and they’re all based around video conference calls. So, whether you’re in a 10 person Zoom meeting or a one-on-one Skype session, you better bring your A-game. There’s no telling what might be on the agenda.

Name: Alexander the Great: Alexander's Campaign from Macedonia to India
Description:
Alexander the Great is the second "historical" title of the One Page Games series.
It’s a quick game where you play the role of Alexander on his march from Macedonia to India, where he will meet the Indian army at the Hydaspes river (326BC).

The game uses the engine of Hannibal ad Portas with several changes introduced to better represent the campaigns of Alexander:

     Companions special rules
     Persian and Indian armies
     Army Morale


New stratagems and events have been added to provide new challenges to the player.

–description from the publisher
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

Name: Shrdlu
Description:
A row of five cards is dealt out, some of which contain constraints like "only 1 of this letter" or "alphabetically earliest letter in the word". Players then race to think of a word that fits the cards dealt.

When the 15-card deck is exhausted, whoever called the most words wins the game.

Name: Battle Ace
Description:
Theme: Your suit of 13 normal playing cards is an elite company of warriors with different combat strengths and movement rates.

Objective/Game Play: From a random layout on a board space, your cards move and attack the enemy warriors, taking as many as you can as you try to capture their king or stronghold. You can stack your cards to increase their combat score.

In Battle Ace, face-down spare cards form a playing "board" area and the two armies (hearts and spades) are shuffled then placed in two face-up rows at either end of this "board". A card or stack is then moved by the player on alternate turns.

Players choose just one action on their turn: Move, Stack. Attack, Pack

The game ends when either a king is killed/taken or a king reaches the opponent's back row. Bonus points are awarded for either of these.

The players add up the melee abilities (face-values of number cards, King/Queen/Jack = 10) plus any bonus points from achieving a win condition. Highest total wins.

Variations: There are optional rules for jokers, adding dice, campaigns and much more.

Name: Triveneto (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Ticket to Ride Triveneto is a fan-produced map of Triveneto (the land of Venice) by Giovanni Salamon (Gh48). The map can be played with the original rules of TtR Europe or with the TtR Triveneto's custom rules.

TtR Triveneto is designed by Gh48 and the digital version was made by Gh48 and Natascia Torres with the help of RDN_ROXAS

Name: Microscopic
Description:
Welcome to a world invisible to the naked eye, where cells evolve and compete to grow into the biggest, strongest, and fastest living organisms.

You will start off small and slow and weak. Collect enough genes to begin laying down cells, then choose which adaptations to focus on and which organisms will give you the best edge.

As you grow, you will need to make sacrifices to get to the next level, but everything ramps up as you race to the end, claiming the most organisms to win.

During their turn a player plays cards from their hand to their tableau and finishes by drawing. The game ends when any player claims three organisms (two for a 4-player game), which is also the win condition.

There is also a solitaire and co-op version with similar game play.

Name: Ticket to Fly (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Ticket to Fly is a French language expansion for Les Adventiers du rail.  Set in the US, it allows for flight between major US cities, using custom cards and TtR mechanics.

Journeys are:

Los Angeles–Chicago

San Francisco–Atlanta

Portland–Nashville

Los Angeles–Miami

Vancouver–Montreal

Los Angeles–New York

Seattle–New York

Name: Melbourne (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Travel the Hoddle Grid or see the sites in St. Kilda.  Your favorite train game now travels through Melbourne!  by Peter McIntyre

Name: Rivers of Africa (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

A 6-section PDF map, along with PDF destination tickets and a JPG image of the Rivers of Africa

Name: The Sound of Midnight
Description:
Deck building card game. Solo to unlimited player. Lovecraft-like themed. Standard game allows for around 4+ players. Add another artifact pack to allow additional 4+ more players. Game can be played with players having their own packs. Players can join any active game at the start of any round. No need to wait for end of game to join.

This is a 2 pack game, both packs are needed for the full game.
Book of Artifacts
Book of incantations

Casting "Bewitched" Incantation cards will affect everyone including the caster. There are "Aura" Incantation cards that help protect from "Bewitched" cards.

Tournament style also available, in the rules.

Name: ZU Tiles: Hime – Starter Set 2
Description:
ZU Tiles: Hime is a strategic tile placement game based loosely on the creatures of the Chinese Zodiac. Players choose a creature (or creatures) to build customized decks around in order to out think and out play their opponent(s). Players earn points by creating patterns of “compatible squares” using creatures or by battling and capturing opposing creatures. The first player to 12 points wins! Think Collectable Card Game meets Dominoes...but with amazing anime inspired art and super fun tile interactions.

ZU Tiles: Hime is a quick and easy game for the whole family, focusing more on its unique compatibility mechanics than it does on combat. We're hoping you have more fun and more genuine enjoyment of playing vs. the sometimes cutthroat competition that other more competitive deck building games can become. Relax. Take your time. Smile more. Laugh a bit. Enjoy yourself.

Starter Set 1 consists of the Pig, Rabbit, Ram, Tiger, Horse, and Dog tiles.
Starter Set 2 consists of the Dragon, Snake, Rooster, Rat, Ox, and Monkey tiles.

Name: HEKKspedisjon: Ekspedisjon Europa
Description:
HEKKspedisjon - Ekspedisjon Europa is a competition driven, mid level strategy game.

You play as one of six characters, traveling around Europe. Each character has his own strengths and weaknesses. You will encounter people that may help or hinder you along the way and you will rely on getting your hands on the best expedition-gear to stay in front. Both regular shops and the black market is available to you as long as you have cash in hand. Both competitions and individual expedition-goals will drive you towards your goal, but don't underestimate the power of gaining knowledge of places and people you encounter.

Each turn consists of 4 phases.
First phase is "Adjusting hunger". The player adjusts their hunger bar according to their placement on the board.
Second phase is "Shopping phase". Players may do repairs on their vehicle (if applicable) or buy food. Players may also buy items from the black market (if in a city) or from the shop.
Third phase is "Action / work". The player chooses whether they will do a job to earn money or draw a city event/travel event card.
Fourth phase is "Movement / work" The player chooses whether they do a job to earn money or if they want to move towards their next expedition goal.

The game ends when the first person enters the "End" position on "The winning track".
To win you need to collect expedition points and/or knowledge points. The first player to gain enough points to enter the "End" position of "The winning track" is the winner of the game.

Name: City Break
Description:
In British English, a city break is a short holiday spent in a city. City breaks are perfect for anyone looking to relax and get away from it all for a few days, as well as seeking out authentic experiences. City Break is about your memories that you are proud of and like to tell people about, and the roles you adopt when you talk about your past travels!
You come back from your city breaks very enthusiastic and ready to share them with others. Your memories turn into posts on social media or face-to-face narrations about what you have observed, encountered, or undergone. You have to announce your adventures to the world! And you don't usually tell trivial stories!
Who are you when you boast about where you went and what you did or saw? When you talk passionately about the arts, you turn into a Culture Creature. You are also the Royalty Buff who devours biographies of kings and queens and enjoys visiting their castles and palaces. There is an inner Happy Foodie inside you who loves mentioning unique and memorable food and drink experiences. Your social media profiles reveal a Nature Lover who marvels at the mysteries of nature and appreciates natural beauty. Only a Sights Seeker would plan ahead for trips to the world's busiest sights and landmarks. Your followers can't wait to watch live the Motion Addict who loves public transport, the best way to connect to the city.

City Break is a one-of-a-kind puzzle-solving board game specifically designed for a pair of gamers. What makes City Break truly awesome is that it manages to achieve an incredible strategic depth in a two-player setting. City Break is about adapting to new information, making the right choices at the right time, and solving the puzzle of the combinations of available digit-tiles, cards, and action tokens. The game gets more and more intense with each played card, while you have to keep an eye on your opponent's playing space so as not to be surprised by suddenly ending the game!

Players use cards to fill six columns with memories, creating narratives about their past travels. They need to make sure that their narratives are credible, so they must bring them into a state of equilibrium or harmony. The credibility of a narrative is determined by its 3 sub-columns of values. Equilibrium is when a part of your narrative is in balance with the other two parts taken together (for example, B = A + C). Harmony is when two parts of your narrative balance each other out (for example, B = C).

You pursue a diversity of interests when you travel, and you develop new personas when you talk about where you went and what you did or saw. Each of the 6 outlined columns of cards of your tableau corresponds to a + or = represented at the bottom of the 90 personas. Each persona has a combination of 2 + and/or = indicating the 2 narratives you need to be credible. + symbols indicate which narratives you need to bring into equilibrium. = symbols indicate which narratives you need to bring into harmony.

At the end of your turn, if all 6 of your outlined columns of cards either have complete narratives placed on them or are disabled, your opponent gets one final turn. The game then ends and players calculate their final scores.

Your goal is to score the most Victory Points by assembling long credible narratives, developing personas, achieving target values, matching images, and earning titles. Are you quick-witted enough to deal with changing conditions, elements of randomness, and unpredictable opponents? Find out in City Break!

Name: Uradalom
Description:
The game takes place in the medieval Europe where the players lead their estates as landlords. They must hurry with afforestation, regulation of rivers, and cultivating the fields to build a nicer and richer manor.

Each player rolls his 6 dice, then chooses one of them and draws the area corresponding to his number/colour on the map, then passes the other dice to the left neighbour using the dice holder and chooses one of the 5 dice he has, then passes this one and so on. When you run out of dice, the round is over and the next round begins in the same way. The game ends when all players have completed their map, i.e. filled in all the squares.

The player who scores the most points from building ponds, plough, forest, river, house wins. Each area has a different scoring system.

There are 2 variants of the game, one is a more tactical while the other one is faster. During the game common and hidden goal cards can be used optionally.

Name: Crafty Puggles
Description:
The late Viscount Pennington of Meyersbury has hidden his invaluable treasure in the gardens of his sprawling mansion. Many treasure hunters have tried to find it and have failed. That doesn’t mean all is lost! You’re a trainer of some crafty puggles - cute, cuddly, treasure-sniffing critters with a nose for all things bling. Can you guide them to the hidden treasure? Let’s dig to win BIG!

Crafty Puggles is a tile placement and path building game that will transform your family game nights! Kids will learn and master basic fractions, pattern recognition, strategy, planning and creativity to guide their puggles to the ultimate treasure! It isn’t always a walk in the park because there are tons of twists and turns. It’s fun and different every time you play!

In Crafty Puggles, you are treasure hunters guiding your trained puggles to dig their way to the hidden treasure. Your goal is to lay path tiles in your garden grove and help your puggle reach the treasure. You must also pay attention to what opponents are doing and strategically prevent them from finishing their paths.

The game board is divided into four garden groves, one for each player. Each garden grove consists of 20 squares in 4 rows and 5 columns. The treasure is located in the central treasure square. You create a path on the board by placing path tiles on the squares in your garden grove and connecting the muddy parts only. A path can also be blocked by the hound.

Every player starts with 1 puggle den and 1 puggle pawn of their choice. Place your puggle pawn at the start square of your puggle den mat. You keep path tiles you collect during the game in the Banked Tiles area. you can bank a maximum of 3 tiles. Dice roles will help you place your tiles, rotate your tiles, move your puggle and activate powers.

The first player to create an unblocked path from the start square to the central treasure square wins the game!

Name: Dominion: Allies
Description:
It's a celebration! People are dancing in the streets, and riding horses through the dance halls. You've finally formed an alliance with the barbarians to the north. Instead of the streets running red with blood, they'll run, well, the usual color — let's not focus on what color the streets run. The point is, there's peace. Sure, negotiations were tricky. The barbarians are uncouth; they have no five-second rule and stick out the wrong finger when drinking tea. There are perks, too, though. They've given you skulls to drink mead out of and spices to get rid of the skull aftertaste. And you've given them stuff in return: forks, mirrors, pants. It's great for everyone. And with this treaty out of the way, you can get to work on your other neighbors. Soon, all the allies will be yours.

Dominion: Allies, the 14th expansion in the Dominion series, contains 400 cards, with 31 new Kingdom card piles that contain allies who will do favors for you and split piles that you can rotate.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dino Quest
Description:
Your dinosaur family has just moved into Prehistoric Park, a lovely marshy nook. Now, you must explore the park, gain resources and settle in. The first to collect all resources will make this their abode. The Quest is on!

Dino Quest is a resource collection and management game. In Dino Quest, you collect resources to help your dinosaur family settle in prehistoric park. You’re competing with other players to be the first to collect these resources and sometimes even grabbing some from them!

The game has 15 survival cards. Each card lists the resources players must collect during the game. When a player collects the exact quantities of each resource listed on the survival card, they immediately win the game.

There are 3 dice in the game, one number dice and two power dice. When you roll the number dice, you can collect any 1, 2 & 3 resource tokens. When collecting tokens you can either collect all of the same resource or different resources. There are 2 power dice, both have 3 symbols on them: spin, grab and double it. The action spinner lets you perform special actions. You can spin the spinner only if you roll two spins or a spin and a double it.

Your turn begins by rolling all 3 dice. Keep aside any one dice of your choice and resolve the other two. When collecting tokens from the resource bank, you must collect them one at a time without looking! If you collect the quantity mentioned of any 1 resource on the survival card, it does not mean that you ‘lock’ that particular resource. Opponents can still grab tokens off you and reduce your quantity. When grabbing resources from opponents you must always pick the top most token from any pile. Once you’ve performed all actions, your turn ends. If at the end of a turn you have the exact quantity of all resources listed on the survival card, you win the game. Otherwise the game continues.

Name: Lasuf Futbol
Description:
A soccer-themed card game:

On their turn, each player must play a soccer player cards with the colors red, yellow, green and blue. As soon as he draws a goal of a color, he must play that card and defend it with soccer player cards of the same color.

His rivals must use the color cards to try to score a goal in a same color goal. The player who receives three goals in his goal is eliminated, the last one left in play is the winner.

It has several cards more related to the real sport, which are applied to offer variations and a minimum of strategy.

Name: OMNIA Collectible Deckbuilding Game
Description:
OMNIA is a collectible deckbuilding game in which each player contributes a portion of the cards used for each game. 
When the game starts, each player has a ‘’Player Deck” identical to each other player. As the game progresses, players use Source cards to purchase other cards from the Shop Zone and add them to their Player Decks. Players then use these cards to battle with other players, and fight to build the deck with the highest Prestige!

Players can collect cards, and build ‘’Flavor Decks’’ of their own to change the pool of cards that can appear in the Shop Zone over the course of a game. In this way players can not only increase the chances of a card appearing, but also gives players a chance to try out each other’s cards, to discover new strategies, and to find new cards to include in their own Flavor Deck in future games.

New cards are released regularly in booster packs, as well as pre-constructed, single player theme decks that give new players a quick, and easy way to get started!

OMNIA Collectible Deckbuilding Game is for 2 or more players ages 14 and up, but is best played with 4 players

Name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Ally: Scabbers
Description:
This Game 1 card was made available during Gen Con 2021.

This Ally carries the following ability:

Choose one:
Gain 1 [LIFE]; or discard an Ally to gain 3 [ATTACK]
Families: Game: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle (The OP)

Name: Monsters Arena
Description:
Monsters Arena is a battle game for children. Each player take a deck (they are different for each monster) and in own turn plays a card. On the card there are values for attack and defense. Simply subtract values and damage enemy of correspondence result. At start of the game each monster has ten life. The monster who remains with life at the end will be the winner.
If you play more than two players you have also to choose which opponent attack.
Each monster has also some asymmetrical powers that can help during the battle.
In the end the Arena has special rules to be applied each turn.

—user summary

Name: Ground Assault
Description:
On the modern battlefield, military units face off against each other, the terrain, and the elements. Carve out the best strategy to navigate the terrain and build structures to control land. But be on your guard! Pitfalls await you around every turn, and your entire strategy can quickly unravel…

Ground Assault® is a military-themed game where two to four players navigate challenging terrain, build structures to take control of land, and battle to defend their land.

The object of the game is to control six pieces of land at the same time across the battlefield before your opponents do the same. Each time you play, the tiles forming the battlefield are randomized, making each game a unique challenge!

A turn starts with 10 actions points that can be used in various ways. The most common ways to use the AP are moving troops around the board and using a combination of AP and skill cards to build something on a terrain tile which represents a piece of land. For instance, if you're on a river tile and you have the correct skill card (in this case the Engineer skill card) you can build a bridge across the river (you flip the tile over and the river becomes a bridge). Then you put your land control cube on the tile to mark that you own it.

The game ends for a specific player if they run out of troops. Troops can be lost in battles. The game ends altogether when one player acquires six pieces of land.

The catchphrase of the game is "Control the Field, Win the War." So it's all about maneuvering your troops around the battlefield (made up of terrain tiles), building structures to take control, and then defending them against attack.
With 100% hand-painted artwork by graphic novel illustrator Mark Woods-Hawkins and unique mechanics, Ground Assault® is a must have game in your collection!

Name: Infection
Description:
Currently, various infectious diseases are spreading around the world. Players participate in the game as part of the CDC and must quarantine and treat infected patients in the most efficient way.

The goal of the game is to prevent the spread of infectious diseases among flares distributed in each city.

The first player in each round starts with a vaccine card. He throws all the dice and selects one set of the same scale dice in one color in the order of play and takes them.

Each round proceeds in the order of the next three steps.
dice rolling (infection and research), dice distribution (allocation), and worksheet writing (isolation and treatment).
All players share all the dice in order until they disappear, and fill out their own worksheet paper. (Players who take the dice must immediately record all the dice scales they took into the worksheet.) When all players finish writing the worksheet, the round ends with isolation treatment.

The next player will take the vaccine card and become the first player to proceed with the new round.

If the following situation occurs while playing several rounds, the game ends after playing the round:  a player fills up both the infected patient and the vaccine treatment section in two wards, Or if a player O marks his third time in a space where he's in a worksheet or a shortage of hospital rooms.

When the game is over, the player with the highest total wins by calculating each of the following scores: Treatment score, infection patient score, vaccine treatment inventory score, infection eradication score, vaccine treatment acquisition rate score, and hospital room shortage score.

Name: Go, Gorilla!
Description:
Go Gorilla! is a balance game that promotes motor skills. Build a palm tree and place the monkey without the palm tree collapsing or being knocked over by the gorilla. There are 3 different game modes available: cooperative, against each other, or as a free game. 


Go Gorilla! ist ein Balance-Spiel welches die motorischen Fähigkeiten fördert. Baue eine Palme und platziere den Affen, ohne dass die Palme einstürzt oder vom Gorilla umgeworfen wird. Es sind 3 verschiedene Spielmodi verfügbar: gemeinsam, gegeneinander oder als freies Spiel.

Name: Mission: Cheese!
Description:
The game consists in the little ones going through various tests and thus receiving the portions of cheese necessary to win the game.

Cooperative game mode: all the kids play together to win the cheese portions before grandma comes home! Competitive: Through teams you have to try to win as many cheeses as possible before grandma comes home or when the cat's plate of cheese is emptied (=end of the game).

The rounded cube is dragged across the roof of the house and will randomly and magically appear from one of the lower doors, thus defining the color of the card that must be overcome to get the cheese. Red cards: Say one thing of the color. Green card: guess the shape. Blue card - imitate the sound of the animal that appears on the card.

When the mouse lands on the grandma space, she moves one space towards the front door. If the cube rolls through the cat door or the mouse lands on the cat, a portion of cheese is given back to the plate.

The game ends when Grandma comes home or the plate of cheese is empty.  The person with the most cheese slices wins.



Das Spiel besteht darin, dass die Kleinsten verschiedene Tests durchsetzen und so die Käseportionen erhalten, die erforderlich sind, um das Spiel zu gewinnen.Kooperativer Spielmodus: Alle Kinder spielen zusammen, um die Käseportionen zu gewinnen, bevor die Oma nach Hause kommt! Wettbewerbsfähig: Durch Teams müssen Sie versuchen, möglichst viele Käse zu gewinnen, bevor die Oma nach Hause kommt oder wenn der Katzenteller aus Käse entleert wird (=SPielende).

Der abgerundete Würfel wird über das Dach des Hauses gezogen und wird zufällig und magisch von einer der unteren Türen erscheint und so die Farbe der Karte definiert, die überwunden werden muss, um den Käse zu erhalten.
Rote Karten: Eine Sache der Farbe auf der grünen Karte sagen: die Form der blauen Karte erraten - das Geräusch des Tieres, das auf der Karte erscheint, imitieren.

Wenn die Maus auf dem Oma-Feld landet, bewegt sich diese ein Feld in Richtung Haustür. Rollt der Würfel durch die Katzentür oder landet die Maus auf der Katze, wird dem Teller ein Käse zurückgegeben.

Name: Black Rose Wars: Ordalia
Description:
Ordalia Cards represent specific tasks Mages must perform by the end of the game to prevent the Black Rose from gaining additional Power Points. Each Ordalia Card has two different tasks; each completed task will grant Power Points to both the Mage and the Black Rose, but if the Mage fails to perform any of his/her tasks, he/she will lose against the Black Rose.

Contains 24 Ordalia cards (12 in Italian and 12 in English)

Name: Operación Backbone: La invasión aliada del Protectorado, 1942-1943
Description:
Operation Backbone: La Invasión Aliada del Protectorado, 1942-1943 is a wargame for 2 players, published in the Spanish wargaming magazine Alea (#37), simulating the hypothetical invasion of the Spanish Protectorate of Morocco, as a follow-up of Operation Torch in December 1942. The game is based in the contingency plans of the Allied staff should Spain, pressed by Germany, intervene militarily against Torch.

With a classical hex & counter "I go - You go" mechanics, the Allied player must control almost all cities in Spanish Morocco to win.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Barikarám
Description:
Barikarám (Sheepdogs)

A family game that even children can learn easily.  Players act as sheepdogs whose goal is to gather the dispersed flock into the sheep pen, but while doing so, they must keep out intruders. The winner is the player who gathers the most sheep (and points) in the pen.

Each player has a personal board, with the sheep pen in the center. The game includes a pack of tiles showing groups of sheep or some other characters, such as a fox, a wolf, a hen or the farmer.

In the first phase, each player has the option to create a set of four tiles selected from a common stock, or to take one of the existing sets. In the second phase, they place one of their tiles on the board and move a tile to an adjacent space. If it is not empty, the tile (or row of tiles) is pushed ahead in the direction of the move. As a result, tiles are rearranged on the board and in the sheep-pen every turn. The goal is to push as many sheep as possible into the pen while keeping every other creature outside.
 The game has 3 optional modules, which can be integrated into the gameplay either individually or together to enhance the challenge. The black sheep, if remains in the pen, earns points for the opponents. Trees block some of the spaces. The roosters can help move the worthless hens out of the way.

---
Magyar ismertetÅ‘:

Ebben a gyerekek számára is könnyen érthetÅ‘ családi játékban juhászkutyaként be kell terelnünk a szétszéledt birkanyájat a karámba, miközben igyekszünk távol tartani minden haszontalan vagy káros elemet. A játék végén az nyer, aki a legtöbb birkát (és pontot) gyÅ±jti össze a karámon belül.

Mindenki saját táblán játszik, melynek a legnagyobb részét a karám foglalja el.  A játékhoz tartozik továbbá egy csomag lapka, benne különbözÅ‘ értékÅ± birkacsoportokkal és más karakterekkel: rókával, farkassal, tyúkkal és a gazdával.

A játék elsÅ‘ fázisában a játékosok sorrendben egy-egy négyes csoportot képeznek a véletlenszerÅ±en kihelyezett lapkakészletbÅ‘l, vagy magukhoz vesznek egyet már meglévÅ‘ csoportokból.  A következÅ‘ fázisban kihelyeznek egy-egy lapkát a saját táblájuk szélére, majd elmozgatnak egy bármilyen lapkát a szomszédos mezÅ‘re. Ha ez a mezÅ‘ nem üres, az ott lévÅ‘ (és esetleges további) lapkák egy mezÅ‘vel eltolódnak a mozgás irányában. Ezáltal a táblán – és így a karámban is – folyamatosan átrendezÅ‘dnek a lapkák. A játékosok célja, hogy minél több birkát toljanak be a karámba, de minden más teremtmény kívül maradjon.

A játék 3 opcionális modullal rendelkezik, melyek egyenként vagy együtt beépítve a játékmenetbe fokozzák a kihívást. Ilyenek a fekete bárányok, amelyek ha a karámban maradnak, az ellenfeleknek hoznak pontot. A fák blokkolnak bizonyos mezÅ‘ket, a kakasok viszont a lábatlankodó tyúkokat tarthatják távol.

Name: Regime Rumble: Pax Britannica Expansion
Description: This expansion adds 4 British leader miniatures (Margaret Thatcher, Winston Churchill, Henry VIII, and Elizabeth II), 1 corgi miniature, and 4 associated Clone Cards to the base game.  The miniatures are supplied unassembled and unpainted.

Name: Der Trötofanten-Zirkus
Description:
Look and be amazed: the world's largest elephant circus is in town!

All the great elephants want to thrill the spectators with their tricks – but the tootophants are the real stars! You've never heard of tootophants? They are a very rare breed of elephants with golden trumpet noses that are much louder than their fellow elephants with trunks. Now the elephant circus is looking for a new circus director, because every animal would like to have the ring to itself – and there's a lot of confusion! Which one of you can collect the most elephants and tootophants and play the “trumpet” to his fellow players?

Build your own elephant circus in Der Trötofanten-Zirkus! To do this, at the end of the game you must have as many elephants and tootophants in front of you that are happy with you as circus director and follow you voluntarily. In the scoring, each animal lying open in front of you counts as +1 point.

At the beginning of each game round, each player draws a card from the edge of the ring and keeps it face down in his hand. In a clockwise direction, each player now takes a turn. Only when the player to your right has completed his turn, you show your card to your fellow players and take your action.

The game ends immediately when the last card has been drawn from the edge of the circus ring and applied. Now it is time for the scoring, and the points are counted. The player with the most points wins!

Name: Lisbon Tram 28: One Way Promo Cards
Description:
Expand your "Lisbon Tram 28" game with these 4 new special places to visit:

Card #1 - Sta. Justa
Card #2 - Bica
Card #3 - Lavra
Card #4 - Glória

Available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Ukaž, co umíš
Description:
Czech board game about knowledge. This game was to test children's knowledge in a fun way. The children are accompanied by a pioneer who shows them the correct answers to the questions.

Translation of the name is "Show what you know".

Description of components and game mechanism:
The game contains a playing area, which is divided into two equally large circles. One circle contains questions on its perimeter - and the other circle contains answers to those questions. In total, the game contains 8 sets of questions and answers to various knowledge topics. The questions are from topics: technology, physics, history, sports, riddles and knowledge of Czechoslovakia.

The game also contains one figure that depicts a child pioneer (scout), who has a wand in his hand and points it to the ground - to questions and answers. The figure can be rotated in the base.

At the beginning of the game, players choose one game board with questions and place it in the game box.  The player then places the pioneer piece in the center of the question circle (the pioneer pedestal fits into the recess) and the player turns the pioneer stick to the question he wants to answer. The player then tries to answer the question. Players take turns and count points for correctly answered questions. The winning player who answered the most questions correctly.

Name: Glory&Galleons
Description:
The game is set in a fantasy medieval realm where the battles take place in the air. Each player is a commander of a galleon fleet that floats in the air thanks to special crystals and balloons.

Every fleet has unique deck of cards. There are three location cards on the table. Each round players add their cards to these locations. At the end of a round, the scores are calculated and one of the player gets domination in the specific location. By covering special icons on the cards, players receive extra bonuses.

During battles players receive Victory Points. Whoever has the most VPs at the end of the game is the winner.

There is very clever variant for 1 player included.

Name: Kingdom Come: Deliverance – The Board Game
Description:
Enter the Lands of the Bohemian Crown at the onset of the Hussite wars. In times like these, trust is scarce, and faith is shaken. It is a conflict of religious beliefs that turns brother against brother, and it is  the common man who pays the toll. Whether you hide in the deepest cellar or the tallest tower of a monastery, the flames of war will reach you there too. Tread lightly -- and godspeed!

Kingdom Come: Deliverance - The Board Game is a 1-4 player cooperative campaign app-driven board game that brings the Lands of the Bohemian Crown to your table! Live through the harrowing times and immerse yourself in this epic narrative journey in the Holy Roman Empire.

Throughout the campaign, you will be able to develop your characters and encounter new challenges on your journey. Each scenario in a campaign is a completely unique experience, bringing you to new locations and introducing new people. The game features a living world that remembers - characters will react to your actions, and you’ll be able to observe their behavior. But don’t waste your time - guards are patrolling at every step, so tread lightly, because they’re not keen on people like you.

The app will give you all the information you need for every scenario - from the setup to the tear-down. As you enter each location, you’ll be greeted with a rich world to explore, and it is up to you to decide where to go first. Throughout the game, you’ll be accompanied by an adaptive sound design - your actions will not only alter the story, but also the vast soundscapes. Every dialog and conversation is professionally voice acted, immersing you in the world even more.

—description from the publisher

Name: Last One Standing
Description:
Last One Standing is a snake-like game in which each player has two pawns to move around on the board using cards and tile abilities. Once you cannot move, you are out. The game ends when only one player is left.

On your turn, you will play a card from your hand, determining how many spaces to move. Before you play the card, you are allowed to play a tile from your hand.

Whenever you move a piece, you will flip the tile it just left, which may have an effect.

Name: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings – Hundred Kingdoms Household Knights Regiment Set
Description:
Following the sweeping reforms of Charles Armatellum at the onset of his conquests, the ceremony of dubbing can only be performed by an Imperial noble of at least the rank of Margrave or Count Palatine. The anointment, moreover, can only take place after a battle in which the prospective knight has blooded his blade. These mandates were established to ensure that only men of true prowess earned the rank of Knight. Even with the Empire dissolved, those mandates are well preserved traditions and those who ignore them meet ridicule. In fact, a recurring article presented in the Imperial Conclaves is the appointment of Counts Palatine, to replace those who may have fallen in battle or died or old age.

The massed charge of Household Knights is one of the most powerful weapons at the disposal of a Hundred Kingdoms commander. Hundreds of pounds of obdurate metal and muscle, forged through years of training and experience, they have shattered men, formations, and kingdoms throughout the ages.

Name: Koruru: New Zealand
Description:
Koruru, also known as Knuckle-Bones, is a game of dexterity, already played in ancient times with stones or animal bones. This is the Maori version.

Basically, you take all pieces in one hand, throw them into the air and try to catch as many as you can with the back of your hand. Then you throw the caught pieces up again and try to catch at least one of them with your palm. This is the „Taw“ stone; if you caught more than one piece, select one for Taw. The Taw is then used for several variants.

Name: Kinderpulok
Description: The players should lay out picture cards on their game board according to the chosen rule variant. At the beginning of the game, players are given a certain number of picture cards and lay them out on the given places on their board. During the game, players receive new picture cards and exchange more usable ones for the ones already on the board until the target pattern is met.

Name: Puppet Masters
Description:
Puppet Masters is a game where players choose from 27 Masters, powerful characters with differing amounts of health or magical prowess, each with special abilities encouraging a certain style of play. Then the players each pick up to two decks from the 18 different factions ranging from undead to angels to steampunk. All chosen decks by all players are shuffled together into a single draw pile, from which the minions, Puppets, are drawn into the arena. These can be bought and used by the players or hunted for money, money which can be spent on spells of destruction or items to buff Puppets. It is a flexible game, addictive, easy to learn but hard to master and fits up to 4 players in free for all or 2v2 formats.

The single draw pile is to guarantee all players have access to all things in the game. If there is something directly counter to your strategy in the game in play, you can either buy it up so your opponent can’t use it or destroy it before they get it. Players can attack each other, each other’s Puppets, or the Puppets in the arena. The replay value of this game is very high due to the massive amount of combinations in the game of Masters and Puppets, plus the different strategies of gaining many cheap puppets or getting just one or two very strong ones and giving them a lot of items, or anything in between.

There are four phases of each turn, during which Players can perform different actions. In the recovery phase players receive gold and replenish their Puppets' energy, and the maintenance phase they can take turns buying items and spells for the upcoming battle. In the possession phase, players bid on Puppets to control using their Master character's strings (a finite resource moved around throughout the battle to control Puppets), the player with the highest bid on a Puppet gets it as their own. Then, finally, the action phase, where players use spells and Puppets to attack each other. Player turns in each round are infinite as long as you have things to do. This is limited instead by money/strings/Puppet strength to perform actions.

The game ends when there is only one player/team left in the game.

The winner is the last Player/Team remaining on the field.  If a player is reduced to 0 hit points, they are out of the game.

Name: Shimiagaran
Description:
Shimiagaran are a forgotten breed of ancient scientists, wiped out from history by the cruel alchemists, out of jealousy, despite, and greed. The beliefs of mainstream alchemy could not bear the thought of another group beating them to the elixir of life. Hence, they got the kingdoms to support them, announced the elixir of life impossible, and denied the existence of Shimiagaran.

"Shimiagaran" is a play on the word "alchemists" in Farsi, something like "Alchemystery" if you will.

Shimiagaran is a competitive push your luck and resource management family game. In this game, players have to gather the necessary ingredients for concocting Light and Dark Potions. Ingredients are distributed in two separate sacks at the start of the game: the White Sack, and the Black Sack, which include a different number of Tarantulas. The White Sack has a drafting mechanism, and the Black Sack has a push your luck mechanism. After gathering the required ingredients and making the necessary potions, players can mix their potions to make legendary Elixirs.

Each player has 3 containers: a bottle to keep liquid ingredients in (white and red), a mortar to keep the plant ingredients in (green and pink), and a bag to keep mineral ingredients in (blue and yellow). Each container can hold a total of 5 cubes, and tarantulas can be kept in any container. At the beginning of the game, the white sack has many ingredients and few tarantulas, and the black has few ingredients and many tarantulas. As the game goes on and players take action, all the cubes, including tarantulas circulate between the two sacks.

On a player's turn they can perform one of the following actions:
Take cubes from one of the sacks or Make a potions or elixirs for Victory Points.

Players keep their cards beside their player board, and the amount of VP any player has is public. When one player surpasses the 30VP, the game ends after 2 more rounds.

Name: Alakazum! 2
Description:
Alakazum 2 is an expansion for the game Alakazum! Witches and Traditions with 70 additional cards. As in the core game, players need to gather different characters of the same culture, level them up and, finally, use their power to defeat one of the dangerous American traditions. This expansion includes a new final boss called “Armazon”, which is invincible. Additional characters with new powers are included in this expansion, for example those who come from Castilla and Madrid. The Miserable Witch Pot is also a highlighted new card that will help the players who are losing the game.

The expansion also includes a new game mode: the challenge mode. Advanced players may take a challenge random at the beginning of the game. In this mode they will need to achieve a special goal if they want to win the game.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Samsara: Das Rad der Wiedergeburten
Description:
The game teaches themes from Buddhism and rebirth.

Basically, it's a race in which you want to be the first to reach space 64 (single victory). Since the game is played in 2 groups, there is also a group victory when all members of the group reach space 64.

A player rolls the dice and may - depending on the current special rule - move on, take a black or white stone, jump to a certain square. take an event card, etc. White stones can be exchanged for a stupa, which provides an aid to rebirth (restart). White and black stones may not be taken to the target field and must be worked off by sitting out.

In addition to the game instructions, the game box also contains a manual with a detailed explanation of the individual fields and their meaning in Tibetan Buddhism.

Name: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 4 – Cambalache
Description:
Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 4 is a card game where Argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: Ram vs. Stag: The Battle of Bir el Gubi, November 19, 1941
Description:
“…an encounter battle carried out too enthusiastically against prepared positions…not seen or recognized until the attack had been launched.” –Summary of the British attack at Bir el Gubi by Lieutenant General Willoughby Norrie.

Ram vs. Stag is a low complexity war game simulation of the first battle fought near the village and oasis at Bir el Gubi in Libya. In response to General Erwin Rommel’s bold offensive the British-led Allied forces launched a counter offensive to defeat the Axis forces that were besieging Tobruk. Dubbed Operation Crusader, the Allied attack was launched on November 18th and caught the Axis by surprise. However, Rommel reacted quickly by withdrawing his armored forces into an arc that stretched south and west of the crucial port. The British armored units groped their way forward attempting to identify and fix their enemy’s positions. Late on November 18th units of the Italian Ariete (Ram) Division were discovered near the village of Bir El Gubi. The 22nd Armored Brigade (Stags), a recently deployed unit to the North Africa, was ordered to attack. In the past, British tanks had sent the Italians into head-long flight and a repeat was expected. Instead, the Italians had dug in and were prepared to fight.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counter parts? Lean and enjoy!

Each turn of the game represents one hour of time.  Each hex is approximately a third of a mile across. Units represent companies of men (infantry), batteries of 4-6 guns (artillery and AT), or 10-12 vehicles (tanks and armored cars).

Each copy of Ram vs. Stag is composed of the following:

8 pages of rules
Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets with game tracks and tables
160 single sided, un-mounted counters

Players will also need a six sided die and an opaque container (mug, envelope or anything similar) to play the game.

Each turn of the game represents one hour of time.  Each hex is approximately a third of a mile across. Units represent companies of men (infantry), batteries of 4-6 guns (artillery and AT), or 10-12 vehicles (tanks and armored cars).
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: You Must Be Bunkers
Description:
The world is ending and you and a group of like minded individuals have a bunker to live out the apocalypse.
However, there are people wanting to join you in your bunker, but there is limited space. You and your group must decide who is worthy to join.

You Must Be Bunkers is a 3 to 5 player party game where  the objective is to take turns to recruit the "best" candidates to join  your bunker to live out the apocalypse. The objective of the game is to get the people you deem worthy into the bunker before it reaches maximum capacity.

Each player gets dealt 3 cards from the each deck. This is your hand. One player is then chosen as the leader for the first round, this can be done by playing rock, paper, scissors or flipping a coin or just picking at random.

It is the leader's job to listen to all the other players and decide who gets to stay in the bunker. It is up to the remaining players to convince the leader to choose their person, by any means necessary. The person the leader chooses stays in the bunker and the player that convinced the leader to pick their person gets a ration.

After the leader has chosen a card and a ration has been given, the leader changes from player to player going around clockwise, you then repeat until you fill the bunker.

The game ends when you have 10 people (including the players) in the bunker. The player with the most rations is the winner!

Name: Holzwurm-Wurfelspiel
Description:
Players create a worm (in the first place you receive its head) by adding colorful body-pieces according with the throw of one dieby adding pieces that match the color of the die. The same colors can;t be side by side, so if a player rolls the same color twice, they lose their turn.

The game ends when the pieces are all distributed,. The player with the longest worm is the winner.
